summary: This document is an email chain from December 2019 discussing a high-profile client who is a victim of revenge porn blackmail. An attorney who previously worked with victims of Jeffrey Epstein seeks FBI guidance on the new, unrelated extortion case. An FBI Supervisory Special Agent advises it is a known scam and directs reporting to the Internet Crime Complaint Center.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the perpetrator in previous cases where the inquiring attorney's law firm represented victims.

events.title: High-profile client receives blackmail threat
events.description: A high-profile New York client receives an email threatening to distribute a sexually explicit video to all his contacts unless he pays money via bitcoin immediately.

events.title: Attorney seeks FBI advice on blackmail case
events.description: An attorney, who previously worked with Jeffrey Epstein's victims, contacts the FBI for guidance on a new, unrelated revenge porn blackmail case involving a high-profile client.

keyFacts: An attorney who previously represented victims of Jeffrey Epstein is handling a new, unrelated case involving a high-profile client being blackmailed with revenge porn.
The blackmail threat involved a demand for immediate bitcoin payment to prevent the distribution of a sexually explicit video.
An FBI Supervisory Special Agent identifies the threat as a well-known scam that has been reported multiple times and advises against paying any money.
The agent directs that the incident can be reported for informational purposes to the FBI's Internet Crime Complaint Center (ic3.gov).
The document shows the ongoing professional network of an attorney involved in the Epstein case, though the new matter is explicitly stated as unrelated.
